attributes.action: Refund our tuition fees for the period of time that our lecturers are on strike.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.thenationalstudent.com/Opinion/2018-01-30/university_lecturers_are_going_on_strike_and_students_should_get_a_refund.html

As per the above article, we as students are estimated to lose out by £675 per student as a result of the impending strike action. That equates to £650m in total. Whilst many students are appreciative of the need and right to strike, we as the 'consumer' should be awarded a refund of our already extensive tuition fees for this period.
attributes.background: From the 22nd February all university lecturers at 85 universities will be going on strike, with regards to their pensions. This is anticipated to last approximately 3-4 weeks. As we will not be taught, we argue that for this period we should be refunded our tuition fees during that period of time.

rejection.details:
The decision to refund student tuition fees would be responsibility of universities, rather than the UK Government or Parliament.

You could start a petition asking the Government to make it law for universities to issue refunds when students don't receive lessons as a result of strikes.
